org.fluidity.deployment.osgi

Interface BundleComponents.Registration.Listener<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the component whose registration events this is a listener for.
    All Superinterfaces:
    BundleComponents.Managed, BundleComponents.Stoppable
    Enclosing interface:
    BundleComponents.Registration

    public static interface BundleComponents.Registration.Listener<T>
extends BundleComponents.Managed
    An OSGi service registration listener. In terms of the Whiteboard pattern, this is an event source that will receive notifications about event consumer registrations.

    This is a BundleComponents.Managed component thus the start / stop logic described therein applies.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void serviceAdded(T component, Properties properties)
      Notifies the event source that a new event consumer has been added.
      void serviceRemoved(T component)
      Notifies the event source that an event consumer has been removed.
      Class<T> type()
      Returns the class that event consumers of interest are expected to register as.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fluidity.deployment.osgi.BundleComponents.Managed

        start

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fluidity.deployment.osgi.BundleComponents.Stoppable

        stop

    • Method Detail

      • type

        Class<T> type()
        Returns the class that event consumers of interest are expected to register as. Service registrations only against the returned class or its name will be recognized as event consumer registration.
        Returns:
        the class that event consumers of interest are expected to register as.

      • serviceAdded

        void serviceAdded(T component,
                  Properties properties)
        Notifies the event source that a new event consumer has been added.
        Parameters:
        component - the event consumer.
        properties - the registration properties of the event consumer.

      • serviceRemoved

        void serviceRemoved(T component)
        Notifies the event source that an event consumer has been removed.
        Parameters:
        component - the event consumer that has been removed.
